Comment:
Hi everyone!

Here I am white against the same opponent I played in Jo's Great Escape Part 2.  I decide to play the Reti here and see how I get on.  How did I get on?  Well, my opponent played a very unusual move on move 2 and followed it up with a couple of queen moves.  I tried to develop normally but I ended up yet again with an inferior middlegame.  In the latter stages of the middlegame all seemed lost - then Glenda found a good square and I think that the game turned around then because she was the vixen in black's henhouse!
2. ............ Be6 - black takes me out of the database on move 2!  A strange move, blocks in his e pawn but how do I take advantage of it?
2. ............ Be6 - black takes me out of the database on move 2!  A strange move, blocks in his e pawn but how do I take advantage of it?
2. ............ Be6 - black takes me out of the database on move 2!  A strange move, blocks in his e pawn but how do I take advantage of it?
4. h3 - necessary as black was threatening Bh3 forcing off the lsbs and invading with the Wicked Witch of the West on h3.

23. h4 - I move my h pawn out of the line of fire of the black lsb and try to swap it off for the black g pawn.  Black advances the g pawn however after Glenda sidestepps the attack from black's remaining rook.
25. Qe2 - this choice of square proves vital for Glenda as she has a line to c4.
